posts.name: Miles.D
posts.cooked: We are looking for a new robot scale and the last thread was from 2017, so I thought it was time for a revival. So what kind of scales does your team use?

posts.name: Garrison
posts.cooked:
I like this scale that I’m pretty sure 3847 recommended at some point.

We’ve had two now (lost one at an event) and haven’t had any issues. The latest one we got was used from Amazon and it has no issues. We usually set a piece of plywood on top to more evenly support the robot.

link_counts.title: Amazon.com : Acteck A-BC200 200LB x 0.2 OZ Digital Heavy Duty Shipping Postal Scale, Stainless Steel : Office Products

posts.name: Dale Yocum
posts.cooked:
I’m a big fan of hanging the robot to weigh it.  Many scales, unless you pay a lot of money, are sensitive to where on their platform the weight is.  We got this one and have been happy with it.  This year the barge would be great for that if you don’t have another place to hang it.

Amazon.com: RoMech 660lb Digital Hanging Scale with Cast Aluminum Case, Handheld 300Kg Mini Crane Scale with Hooks for Farm Hunting Fishing Outdoor (Orange) : Industrial & Scientific

link_counts.title: Amazon.com: RoMech 660lb Digital Hanging Scale with Cast Aluminum Case, Handheld 300Kg Mini Crane Scale with Hooks for Farm Hunting Fishing Outdoor (Orange) : Industrial & Scientific

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
I was about to say the same. We got one from a local Cabela’s, but they are available at many outdoors/hunting goods type stores. Most are overkill for FRC (500+lbs) so they will last a long long time. They also pack nicely into a toolbox drawer.

You can use carabiners on the robot, and the scale, then hold it up across a strong steel rod or pipe. Have 3 or more adults do this depending on the robots weight.

posts.name: Rishabh
posts.cooked: We have a Guardian Floor Scale 4' x 4' 5,000 lbs with TI-500E Indicator that was provided by our school district at our STEM Center, and while its extremely expensive the convenience of being able to just drop the robot on to check weight is worth. I would recommend something like this if you can get your district to pay for it.

link_counts.title: Guardian Floor Scale 4' x 4' 5,000 lbs with TI-500E Indicator

posts.name: Adam Fleming
posts.cooked:
I’ve been looking into getting 4 postage scales for about $20 each to get corner weights in addition to overall robot weight.

50lb Accuteck Postage Scale

You could also get karting scales if you want to get fancy, but those run $800+.

link_counts.title: Amazon.com : ACCUTECK All-in-1 Series W-8250-50bs A-Pt 50 Digital Shipping Postal Scale with Ac Adapter, Silver : Office Products
